intro: Malope lutea, commonly known as yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a fuzzy texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Malope lutea is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as coastal areas and disturbed soils.
